c74object.name: ears.timesquash~
c74object.description: Resizes a buffer while preserving original content

inlet.description: One amplitude buffer for each channel
One phase buffer for each channel
Sets the stretch factor or duration depending on the timeunit attribute.

outlet.description: One amplitude buffer for each channel
One phase buffer for each channel

outlet.digest: Seams, energy map and cumulative energy map
outlet.description: If the extout attribute is set, from the right outlet come three buffers, containing: the position of the carved seams, the energy map at the first iteration and the cumulative energy map at the first iteration

objarg.name: outnames
objarg.description: The outname attribute sets a name (or a wrapped list of names) for each of the buffer outles of the objects in ears. These names are only accounted for if the naming mode is 'Static'.

objarg.name: timestretch
objarg.description: Sets the stretch factor or duration depending on the timeunit attribute.

method.name: (mouse)
method.description: Double-clicking on the object will open the display window for the output buffer(s). If more than 10 buffers are to be output, only the first 10 are displayed.

method.name: list/llll
method.description:
A list or llll in the first inlet is supposed to contain buffer names and will trigger the buffer processing and output the processed buffer names (depending on the naming attribute).
A number or an llll in the second inlet is expected to contain a parameter (depending on the mode). For "repeat" mode, the parameter is the number of repetitions.

method.name: number
method.description: A number in the second inlet sets the timesquash parameter (depending on the ampunit).

method.name: reset
method.description: If the naming attribute is set to 'Dynamic', the reset message will force the dynamic naming to cycle and restart from the first used name. This is especially useful in combination with iterative mechanisms.

method.name: stop
method.description: When a stop message is sent to an object with blocking attribute set to 0, the computation is aborted as soon as possible.

method.name: write
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. Additional optional arguments specify the buffer index (if more than one buffer are stored in the objct) and the filename (otherwise a dialog menu will appear). Additional optional format message attributes specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer, default), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.name: writeaiff
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. Additional optional arguments specify the buffer index (if more than one buffer are stored in the objct) and the filename (otherwise a dialog menu will appear). Additional optional format message attributes specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer, default), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.name: writeflac
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. Additional optional arguments specify the buffer index (if more than one buffer are stored in the objct) and the filename (otherwise a dialog menu will appear). Additional optional format message attributes specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer, default), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.name: writemp3
writeraw
method.digest: Save output as raw file with no header
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. Additional optional arguments specify the buffer index (if more than one buffer are stored in the objct) and the filename (otherwise a dialog menu will appear). Additional optional format message attributes specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer, default), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. Additional optional arguments specify the buffer index (if more than one buffer are stored in the objct) and the filename (otherwise a dialog menu will appear). Additional optional format message attributes specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer, default), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)

method.name: writewv

attribute.name: batchsize
attribute.description: Sets the number of seams processed in batch.

attribute.name: blocking
energy
attribute.description: Sets the energy function used for computing seams.

attribute.name: extout
attribute.description: Also output seams and energy matrices from the right outlet. This attribute is static and can only be set inside the object box.

attribute.name: forwardenergy
attribute.description: Sets the amount of 'forward energy' contribution, i.e. the energy that is obtained by neighboring pixel when a seam pixel is removed.

attribute.name: forwardenergyembed
attribute.digest: Embed Forward Energy In Cumulative Energy
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to embed the forward energy in the cumulative energy matrix. If zero, the forward energy is used as additional weight when finding the best path in the cumulative energy matrix.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Embed Forward Energy In Cumulative Energy

attribute.name: forwardenergytype
attribute.description: Sets the forward energy type.

attribute.name: framesize
attribute.description: Sets the analysis frame size or window size (the unit depends on the antimeunit attribute)

attribute.name: glbleed
attribute.description: Sets the number of frames of invalidation for the Griffin-Lim Algorithm, in case the corresponding method is chosen for phasehandling.

attribute.name: glnumiter
attribute.description: Sets the number of Griffin-Lim iterations, in case the corresponding method is chosen for phasehandling.

attribute.name: glrandomize
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to randomize the phases of the regions subject to the Griffin-Lim algorithm, in case the corresponding method is chosen for phasehandling.

attribute.name: glrect
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to invalidate whole rectangular regions whose phases are recomputed via the Griffin-Lim algorithm, in case the corresponding method is chosen for phasehandling.

attribute.name: hopsize
attribute.description: Sets the analysis hop size (the unit depends on the antimeunit attribute) Floating point values are allowed.

attribute.name: mode
attribute.description: Sets the working mode: either in the Time-Domain or in the Frequency-Domain (default)

attribute.name: naming
attribute.description:
Chooses the output buffer naming policy:
0 (Copy): the buffer name is copied from the input (in-place modification). Notice that some objects do not allow this policy.
1 (Static): a single buffer (and hence buffer name) is created, and always used as output.
2 (Dynamic): a new buffer (and buffer name) is created for each new command. Beware! This may allocate a lot of memory! You can always cycle on a fixed set of names via the reset message.
You can use a shortcut to define the naming policy via a first symbolic argument: use = for copy, - for static and ! for dynamic.

attribute.name: outname
attribute.description: Sets the name for each one of the buffer outlets. Leave blank to auto-assign unique names.

attribute.name: overlap
attribute.description: Sets the overlap factor between the analysis window size and the hop size.

attribute.name: phasehandling
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to compensate phase changes.

attribute.name: regularization
attribute.description: A value between 0 and 1 that sets how much the energy of a bin smears on the ones above and below. For a regularization value of 1, energy is constant vertically across the spectrum, and hence all seams are forced to be purely vertical.

attribute.name: slopemapping
attribute.description: Sets the function to be used for slope mapping: either bach (default) or Max.

attribute.name: timeblock
attribute.description: Sets the duration of each time block to be removed in the antimeunit

attribute.name: timeunit
attribute.description: Sets the unit for time values: Milliseconds, Samples, Relative (0. to 1. as a percentage of the buffer length), The default varies depending on the modules.

attribute.name: winstartfromzero
attribute.description: If on, the first window is centered at framesize/2; if off (default), the first window is centered at zero.

attribute.name: wintype
attribute.description:
Sets the window type. Available windows are: "rectangular", "triangular", "sine", "hann", "hamming", "blackman", "nuttall", "blackmannuttall", "blackmanharris", "gaussian", "sqrthann", "sqrthamming".
For objects that may require different windows for analysis and synthesis, two symbols can be defined (the first one being the analysis window, the second one being the synthesis window).

attribute.name: xfade
attribute.description: Sets the duration of the crossfade, whose unit is set via the antimeunit attribute.

attribute.name: xfadecurve
attribute.description: Sets the curve parameter for the crossfade (for fades of type Curve and S-Curve only). The parameters goes from -1 to 1, 0 being linear (default).

attribute.name: xfadetype
attribute.description: Sets the cross fade type: 0 = None, 1 = Linear, 2 = Sine (Equal Power, default), 3 = Curve, 4 = S-Curve

c74object.discussion: The module uses an implementation of a seam-carving algorithm.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (symbol/list/llll)
entry.description: Incoming amplitude buffer names. One amplitude buffer for each channel

entry.name: Inlet 2 (symbol/list/llll)
entry.description: Incoming phase buffer names. One phase buffer for each channel

entry.name: Inlet 3 (number/llll)
entry.description: Stretch factor or duration. Sets the stretch factor or duration depending on the timeunit attribute.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (symbol/list/llll)
entry.description: Output amplitude buffer names. One amplitude buffer for each channel

entry.name: Outlet 2 (symbol/list/llll)
entry.description: Incoming phase buffer names. One phase buffer for each channel

entry.name: Outlet 3 (list)
entry.description: Seams, energy map and cumulative energy map. If the extout attribute is set, from the right outlet come three buffers, containing: the position of the carved seams, the energy map at the first iteration and the cumulative energy map at the first iteration

entry.name: More details
entry.description: The module uses an implementation of a seam-carving algorithm.

entry.name: Keywords
entry.description: buffer, timesquash, carve, seam, timestretch, content, preserve.
